Jon took a deep breath and stepped inside. The main living room had an alcove with a dinette at one end with a counter at the left that separated it from the kitchen area. Amy motioned for him to sit down while she went into the kitchen to fetch the brownies. She took two glasses from the cabinet and filled them with milk. As she placed the container back in the refrigerator he noted that it was well stocked. Like his own mom Amy’s family obviously had not been skimming on the groceries.

Amy put six brownies on a platter, then brought them with the milk to the table, remarking to Jon, “Hopefully these will serve as a good appetizer for wherever we’re going for lunch.”

Jon swallowed hard in amazement at the casualness of her comment, then smiled as he took the first bite, which electrified his taste buds.

“Wow,” he exclaimed, “this is delicious."

“I know,” smiled Amy as she took a brownie for herself. “Since taking up baking and cooking I’ve already picked up a few pounds, but people tell me its actually not bad. My mom and dad are actually happy so far, though mom fears it could become addictive. For now, I’m just letting my body decide what it likes.”

“Well,” remarked Jon, “I will agree that you look healthier and the most attractive I’ve ever seen you. But what about cheerleading?”

“Good memories, but history. Practicing every day takes up time better used for other things – cheerleading in college is more demanding than in high school and for what? Frankly I’m getting to enjoy cooking along with baking more than performing in front of a crowd. My brain rather than my torso is what needs developing for a career now that I’m in college,” she said as she began devouring her second brownie. Jon, amazed, followed her lead.

“We’ve known one another since, what, the 8th grade? But i guess you are changing and in my opinion for the good. I agree with the mind thing but surely you can tell I’ve been acquiring a few pounds myself,” Jon acknowledged as he chomped into his second brownie and she reached for her milk before taking a third.

Join took a sip from his glass, watching with a pleased expression her obviously enjoying her treat that Amy duly noted. He then continued “I think the pounds I’ve put on this summer should bother me, but what does my mom do? She serves up dishes like chicken alfredo for supper, then leave cookies out when I get home from dates because she knows I’ve developed what she calls a summertime appetite. With food like hers and this any weight concerns go out the window.”

Amy looked him in the eye and settled her chin onto the open palm of her hand reaching up from where her elbow ad arm were braced on the table. “You are over 6 feet tall and less than 200 pounds and fussing over your appetite, probably because of concerns over what other people might think. What would you say if I said I liked husky guys and expect to become a bit of a chubette myself? I seem to be heading that way, you know.”

With that she reached for the last brownie for effect and Jon shook his head in amazement.

“You do know that’s your fourth brownie out of six – and that I’m taking you to lunch when I finish my milk?” he stammered.

“Yes, and I’ll be watching you enjoy me eating whatever just as you did these treats. Margie was right and I’m happy to have found the key after liking you for six years, Amy replied/

“What do you mean?” Jon asked.

“Margie, one of my best friends who analyzes people a lot, says you never looked really happy dating in high school and were frequently stealing glances at heavier girls like they were forbidden fruit for quarterbacks. She thinks you’re secretly a closet chubby chaser,” Amy declared. “That’s part of why I’ve given in to my own appetite, which I totally enjoy – and look what happened.”

Jon put his hand to his brow and nodded down. “Well, i never thought of it that way, but yes I’ve always thought fuller figured girls to be attractive and you to be overly thin, but I never thought they were off limits. I just never was close enough to them for us to develop a relationship.”

“Let’s be honest – you never developed a steady relationship with anyone because it couldn’t be your priority, not with the team, various clubs, a part-time job, a car and your studies. But Margie figured you out and let me know what, in her view, it would take, answered Amy. "But she was apparently off by thirty pounds, because here you are before its become that noticeable.”

“Well, actually, ” he confessed, “i didn’t call because I knew you were changing. I was sorting out other problems and just needed someone accepting and uncritical. I knew you’d always wanted to be closer and so I called. The weight thing was a pleasant surprise and you’re a terrific baker. But now we’re past that and have mutually admitted our improved appetites, so, shall we get going?”

“Certainly,” smiled Amy as she finished her milk.
